title: Home and Away off air for six weeks as it takes Christmas break
text:
(Picture: Channel 5)

Much like in real life, it’s time to say goodbye to the sunshine and beaches this winter as Home and Away has confirmed a mammoth six week Christmas break from Channel 5, meaning Summer Bay fans are in for a bit of a drought over the festive season.

The soap has been firing on all cylinders recently with dramatic storylines and recently teased an even bigger 2020 which will involve new characters and a life changing tragedy which will impact many of our favourites.

But we are in for a wait first, sadly.

The last episode of the year is confirmed to air on Channel 5 on Friday 22 November and is scheduled to then return from its hiatus on Monday 6 January – in which time we will have gone through Christmas, new year and a UK general election.

Storylines including the build up to Raffy’s exit and the trial of Irene have kept fans gripped. And there is more to come.

(Picture: Channel 5)

Channel 7 teased: ‘In 2020, the country’s No. 1 Australian drama will explore stories of love, romance, betrayal and psychological obsession. We see the introduction of a new family which will inject an exciting dynamic to the stellar ensemble cast.

‘And after a tragedy rocks the town, we will watch the community come together at the most unexpected wedding the Bay has ever seen to celebrate a precious second chance at love.’

It is traditional due to the commissioned number of episodes for Home and Away to take an annual break so fans who recently heard whispers of a potential axing needn’t worry as there remains nothing to suggest that Channel 7 or Channel 5 are waving goodbye to the popular drama.

Meanwhile, Neighbours won’t be taking a Christmas break for the second year running as a new deal with the UK keeps the soap on air all year round. So if you want your fix of Australian soap over December, Ramsay Street is where it’s at.
